articles.summary:
THE aim of the West Australian Ballet's periodic series, _Genesis_, is to
nurture choreographic talent from within its own company.
articles.title: A Genesis of talent (The Australian)

articles.author: By Randy Lewis
articles.summary:
As the 48 th Academy of Country Music Awards show got underway Sunday at the
MGM Grand in Las Vegas, the placement of the word "awards" appeared to be no
accident, as it was nearly 50 minutes into the show before the first trophy
was handed out to Thompson Square as top vocal duo.
articles.title: Academy of Country Music show takes its time getting to awards (LA Times)
Blake Shelton to Conduct Kelly Clarkson's Wedding (ETGeneral)

articles.author: Kimberly Nordyke
articles.summary:
The comedienne made the announcement at stand-up show in Cincinnati.

read more
articles.title: Bravo Cancels Kathy Griffin's Talk Show (Hollywood Reporter)

articles.summary:
NEW YORK (Reuters Health) - Shrinking the size of kids' plates and bowls and
encouraging them to eat more frequently throughout the day might help them eat
less and keep off extra weight, new research suggests.
articles.title: Dish size, meal frequency may affect kids' weight (reuters)

articles.summary:
CONAKRY (Reuters) - Guinea's opposition said on Sunday it would reopen talks
with the government on preparations for legislative elections after the ruling
party agreed to its conditions.
articles.title: Guinea opposition says it will return to election talks (reuters)

articles.summary:
(Reuters) - A man who took several hostages in 2007 at a New Hampshire
presidential campaign office for then-U.S. Senator Hillary Clinton was
reported missing Sunday from a halfway house, authorities said.
articles.title: Hostage-taker at Clinton's 2007 campaign office escapes (reuters)

articles.summary:
(Reuters) - Singers Miranda Lambert and Luke Bryan led the winners at the
Academy of Country Music awards on Sunday, while leading nominees Taylor Swift
and Hunter Hayes came away empty-handed in a night honoring top achievers in
country music.
articles.title: Lambert, Bryan lead Academy of Country Music award winners (reuters)

articles.author: By NOAM COHEN
articles.summary:
The bitcoin, a virtual currency created in 2009, has achieved a billion-dollar
milestone that has turned the relatively obscure online means of exchange into
a media sensation.
articles.title: Link by Link: Bubble or No, Virtual Bitcoins Show Real Worth (NY Times)

articles.author: By Randy Lewis, Los Angeles Times
articles.summary:
The singer-songwriter wins four awards, some of them for 'Over You,' her
collaboration with husband Blake Shelton. Luke Bryan is entertainer of the
year.


Rising country singer Luke Bryan was named entertainer of the year and Miranda
Lambert was singled out as a songwriter and a singer on Sunday at the 48th
Academy of Country Music Awards. Lambert picked up significant honors from her
collaboration with husband Blake Shelton on "Over You," a song they wrote
inspired by Shelton's experience as a teenager when his brother was killed in
an automobile accident.
articles.title: Miranda Lambert is Academy of Country Music Awards' top winner (LA Times)

articles.summary:
**BREAKING: **NORTH Korea is reportedly preparing a fourth nuclear test as
South Korea warns of a missile launch, and diplomats are put on notice. Aunt
and uncle call the shots | NZ PM criticised
articles.title: North Korea 'readying nuke test' (Cnet)

articles.summary:
CARACAS (Reuters) - Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelan opposition supporters
rallied in a staunchly pro-government part of the capital on Sunday, answering
a call by their candidate Henrique Capriles and showing strength a week before
the presidential election.
articles.title: Opposition holds big rally in Venezuelan capital (reuters)

articles.summary:
(Reuters) - South Korea's Inbee Park won the Kraft Nabisco Championship by
four strokes on Sunday after shooting a final round 69 to secure her second
major title.
articles.title: Park cruises to victory at Kraft Nabisco Championship (reuters)

articles.author: By Nicole Radzievich ", Of The Morning Call
articles.summary:
Voting begins Wednesday in campaign that resembles a political race.


Kerri Smith didn't graduate Penn State but she still considers herself part of
the Nittany Lions pride.
articles.title: Penn State trustees' campaign heats up (morningcall)

Third-grader Destiniyah Garcia stood on the lawn at Rollins College in a
"Future College Graduate" T-shirt and pronounced the campus "cool."
articles.title: Rollins students mentor, inspire Fern Creek Elementary kids |  Photos (orlandosentinel)

articles.summary:

what else could it be but the biggest week in Aussie style? **Action as it
happens.**
articles.title: Stars of style start a week-long party (Daily Telegraph)

articles.summary:
[Daily News]TANZANIA Golf Union (TGU) has received CVs of two proposed
Zimbabwean coaches to take over the national team job. The candidates include
the former TGU Technical Director, Farayi Chitengwa. TGU Vice - Chairman,
Joseph Tango, confirmed to the 'Daily News on Saturday' in Dar es Salaam that
their Zimbabwean counterparts have provided them with CVs of two coaches this
week for them to consider.
articles.title: Tanzania: Chitengwa Likely to Retake TGU Job (All Africa)

articles.summary:
(Reuters) - Two fledgling technologies could dramatically reshape the $60
billion-a-year television broadcast industry as they challenge the business
model that has helped keep broadcasters on the lucrative end of the media
spectrum.
articles.title: Tech upstarts threaten TV broadcast model (reuters)

articles.summary:
[Observer]Last Friday, two stories in The Observer caught my attention: 'Govt
blocks Bishop Zac from travelling' and 'Imams rounded up; Muslims up in arms'.
articles.title: Uganda: Religion, Politics Should Not Collide (All Africa)

articles.author: Rich Kirchen
articles.summary:
Wheaton Franciscan - Wisconsin Heart Hospital has added a second name to its
sign - Midwest Spine and Orthopedic Hospital - that signals the hospital's
shift to more orthopedic procedures. The orthopedic program at the hospital
has been underway for more than a year with hundreds of spine and other
orthopedic cases performed since November 2011, Wheaton Franciscan said. To
accommodate growth in the orthopedic program, the campus at 10000 W. Bluemound
Road in Wauwatosa recently added a third operatingâ€¦
articles.title: Wisconsin Heart Hospital adds more orthopedic procedures (Biz Journal)
